page.title: 05OTMOOR LEGEND - THOMAS TRYTE
page.content: One dark,stormy evening in December long ago, Thomas Tryte was walking home across Otmoor. Thomas was coming home from Beckley Hill.He could see the surrounding villages such as Charlton,Fencott,Islip, Brill and Kidlington.He was walking along the Roman Road from Beckley to Alchester when he strayed off the path. The futher he went the more lost he got.He was passing a pond,the wild fowl flew off.He cried "Lost!Lost! Lord help me or I die!" No one heard.Again he cried"Lost!Lost!" Again no one heard. Then he heard the curfew bell at Charlton ringing. He thought that if he followed the sound of the bell he would find the path again. He found the path. When he got home his wife and child welcomed him. He bought a bell for Charlton as thanks for his safe deliverance.
